caption: Table 1: Quantitative comparison of different stylization methods.
description: This table presents a quantitative comparison of ReGS against three state-of-the-art methods: ARF [8], SNeRF [4], and Ref-NPR [10].  The metrics used for comparison are Ref-LPIPS (lower is better, indicating better perceptual similarity to the reference), Robustness (higher is better, indicating consistent stylization across viewpoints), and Speed (frames per second, higher is better, indicating faster rendering). The results demonstrate that ReGS significantly outperforms the baselines in both quality and speed.

caption: Table 1: Quantitative comparison of different stylization methods.
description: This table presents a quantitative comparison of ReGS against three state-of-the-art methods for 3D scene stylization: ARF, SNeRF, and Ref-NPR.  The comparison uses two metrics: Ref-LPIPS (lower is better, indicating better perceptual similarity to the reference image), and Robustness (higher is better, indicating better consistency across different viewpoints). Additionally, the rendering speed (in frames per second) is included.  ReGS demonstrates superior performance in both visual quality and rendering speed compared to existing methods.
